result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin B Hudack

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Kaupie
BODY ONLY WARRANT.  DE WILL BE ASSESSED COSTS FOR WITNESSES. ALL NON MONETARY CONDITIONS OF BOND WILL REMAIN

3:53 PM Defendant Kevin B Hudack not in court.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for Kevin B Hudack.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. DE does not appear.  Per the State DE has a warrant in Chippewa County, State asking for a BW and witness fees for officers overtime.  DE has no knowledge of DE's whereabouts.  Court will order a Body Only Warrant. Non monetary conditions of bond will continue. Adj 3:55pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: DE appeared in court June 7,2022
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
DE appears in court, thought his court was set for today, quash warrant, reinstate bond.  Set for PH September 6, 2022 @ 3:30PM.
All non monetary conditions of bond will apply.

1:25 PM Defendant Kevin B Hudack not in court.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. DE does not appear. State will ask for a warrant. Court will order a $1000.00 BW, will extradite, non monetary conditions of bond will apply. Adj 1:27PM.

Certified bond from Eau Claire County 2021CF422
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:34 PM Defendant Kevin B Hudack in court.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Osberg appears with DE.  Waive formal reading of the CC. DE/Atty will waive TL for PH, court instructs on waiver of TL, DE understands, court accepts waiver of TL.  Set for PH June 6, 2022 @ 1:15Pm.  Quash warrant. Adj 1:36PM
OAC report. To date 56 attempts have been made to obtain counsel.
Return on warrant on May 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:30 PM Defendant Kevin B Hudack appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. DE was to appear in person, states he misunderstood and thought he would just get a new court date, didnt know he had to appear in person.  Warrant will remain.  Set for Return on Warrant May 10,2022 @ 1:00PM.  IN PERSON. Adj 1:32PM
Return on warrant on May 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Warrant

2:01 PM Defendant Kevin B Hudack not in court.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court will authorize a PC warrant. $1000.00 cash bond, non monetary conditions will remain.
21GF241 into 22CF19

Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5).   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. No contact with J.S.

1:34 PM DE appears via Zoom from RC Jail. Attorney Knaak appears via zoom for DE. DA Barna appears for the State. Cash bond has been set previously in this case. DE has states his probation hold has been lifted.  Atty Knaak asking for a high sign bond or low cash bond of no more then $250.00.  Per Atty Knaak DE is self employed, has limited ties to the area via his girlfriend.  State has concerns believes the cash bond set is appropriate. 

Court will set a $250.00 cash bnd,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  No contact with J.S.  State will summons in.
Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5).
